importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the current state of the MLB postseason as of October 17, 2025.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The current stage of the MLB postseason, with the Dodgers close to a second consecutive World Series appearance and the Blue Jays tying the ALCS against the Mariners.

keyTakeAways: The Los Angeles Dodgers have a 3-0 lead in the NLCS against the Milwaukee Brewers and are one win away from a second consecutive World Series appearance, making them the first defending champion to achieve this in 16 years.
The Toronto Blue Jays have tied the American League Championship Series against the Seattle Mariners after outscoring them 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, taking a critical momentum shift in the series.
Max Scherzer, 41 years old, delivered a strong performance in Game 4 of the ALCS, allowing only two runs and three hits in 5 2/3 innings, while Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his fifth playoff home run.
The Dodgers' postseason run includes an 8-1 record, with only a loss to the Philadelphia Phillies in the NLDS, and they are now in a strong position to reach the World Series.

Historically, only the Boston Red Sox in 2004 have won a best-of-seven series after losing the first three games; teams with a 3-0 lead win in 40 other cases, underscoring the likelihood of Dodgers' success.
The Dodgers' success is attributed to a strong late-season surge, including a key RBI single by Tommy Edman and a throwing error that led to a run by Freddie Freeman.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in Los Angeles.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are close to securing a second consecutive World Series appearance, making them a major focus of the article due to their historic playoff momentum and statistical significance in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in Milwaukee.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers are the current NLCS opponent of the Dodgers, with the series at 3-0, and are a key opposing team in the context of the Dodgers' path to the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in Philadelphia.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies are referenced as the last team to achieve a second consecutive World Series appearance in 2009 and as the team the Dodgers lost to in the NLDS, providing historical context for the Dodgersâ€™ achievement.

namedEntities.name: Boston Red Sox
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in Boston.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Red Sox are noted as the only team to have won a best-of-seven series after losing the first three games, highlighting the statistical rarity of such an outcome and the high likelihood of the Dodgers' success in the NLCS.

namedEntities.name: New York Yankees
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in New York.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Yankees are referenced as the last team to win back-to-back World Series titles between 1998 and 2000, providing a benchmark for the rarity of current postseason success.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in Seattle.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners are the ALCS opponent of the Toronto Blue Jays, and the series is currently tied after a dramatic comeback in Games 3 and 4.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in Toronto.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are in the midst of a comeback against the Mariners in the ALCS, having outscored them 21-6 in two games to tie the series, making them a central focus of the article's second half.

namedEntities.name: Max Scherzer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 41-year-old former pitcher in Major League Baseball, playing in his 18th season.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Scherzer played a pivotal role in the Blue Jays' Game 4 victory in the ALCS, showcasing his endurance and performance under pressure.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player in Major League Baseball, known for his power-hitting in the playoffs.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Guerrero Jr. hit his fifth playoff home run in the ALCS, contributing significantly to the Blue Jays' offensive surge.

namedEntities.name: Tommy Edman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player in Major League Baseball, known for his offensive contributions in high-pressure games.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Edman drove in the run that gave the Dodgers a 3-1 lead in Game 4 of the NLCS, playing a key role in their momentum.

namedEntities.name: Freddie Freeman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player in Major League Baseball, known for his role in the Dodgers' offense.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Freeman scored a run due to a throwing error by Abner Uribe, helping the Dodgers take a 3-1 lead in the NLCS.

namedEntities.name: Abner Uribe
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player in Major League Baseball, known for his defensive duties.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Uribe committed a throwing error that allowed Freddie Freeman to score, a key moment in the Dodgers' 3-1 win over the Brewers.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Los Angeles Dodgers are one win away from securing a second consecutive World Series appearance after defeating the Milwaukee Brewers 3-1 in Game 4 of the NLCS, with a 3-0 series lead. This would make them the first defending champion to reach the World Series in 16 years, following the last such instance in 2009 with the Philadelphia Phillies. Historically, only the Boston Red Sox in 2004 have won a best-of-seven series after losing the first three games, reinforcing the likelihood of the Dodgers' success. Meanwhile, in the ALCS, the Toronto Blue Jays have tied the Seattle Mariners after outscoring them 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, reversing a 2-0 series deficit. Key performances from Max Scherzer, who pitched effectively in 5 2/3 innings, and Vladimir Guerrero Jr., who hit his fifth playoff home run, have fueled the Blue Jays' momentum, with the series now tied and Game 5 pending.
title: Dodgers close in on second straight World Series appearance, Blue Jays knot up ALCS against Mariners
